title: How is knowledge greater gained and understood, through books or the Internet? (Complete understanding, not awareness) - Quora

response.answer_text: There are pitfalls galore and loads of misinformation on the Internet, but it's foolish to think that everything that's ever been printed in a book is correct. With self-discipline, motivation, and a keen eye, they would be of about the same value to anyone, really. In terms of understanding, however, they both pale in comparison to practice. Knowledge is not an effective substitute for experience. Complete understanding requires both theory and application, but experience is the more vital of the two.
